document.masterDocTitle: On the species of the genus Anthaxia Eschscholtz, 1829 described by A. Théry from Angola in 1947 (Coleoptera: Buprestidae: Anthaxiini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the species of the genus Anthaxia Eschscholtz, 1829 described by A. Théry from Angola in 1947 (Coleoptera: Buprestidae: Anthaxiini)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Anthaxia mashuna
Obenberger, 1931
: 108
. Type locality: Mashonaland: Mazoë [ Zimbabwe , Mazowe, approx.
17 ° 31 ′S
30 ° 58 ′E
].

Anthaxia chalcogenioides
Burgeon, 1941
: 190
. Type localities: Welgelegen [nowadays Lumata, 12 °04′ 60 ″S, 27 ° 31 ′08″E]; Lubombo [ 11 ° 10 ′ 60 ″S, 27 ° 55 ′00″E]. Both localites are situated in the Katanga Province, Democratic Republic of Congo .

Anthaxia ( Anthaxia ) chalcogenioides :
Bílý, 1996
: 22
(synonym of
A. mashuna
).

Anthaxia ( Haplanthaxia ) chalcogenioides :
Bílý, 1997
: 28
, 91 (catalogue, as synonym of
A. mashuna
);
Bellamy, 2008
: 1424
(catalogue, as synonym of
A. mashuna
).

Anthaxia morula
Théry, 1947
: 143
, Fig. 33 , syn. nov. Type locality: [ Angola ] Cubango.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 12–14.
Anthaxia ( Haplanthaxia ) morula Théry, 1947
. 12—
A . ( H .) morula
, holotype, 8.0 mm; 13—the same, original labelling; 14—
A . ( H .) mashuna Obenberger, 1931
, lectotype, 9.0 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type specimens examined.
Anthaxia mashuna
. Lectotype (male, NMPC ,
Fig. 14
): “Mashonaland [h] //
TYPUS
[red, p] // Mus. Nat. Pragae, Inv. 22763 [orange, p+h] //
Anthaxia mashuna
m. Type , Det. Dr. Obenberger [p+h]”. Paralectotype (male, BMNH ): “Mashonaland, Mazoë,
Dez. 1905
(G. A. Marshall ) // Syntype [blue, round, p] // Type [red, p] // 1906 - 182 //
Anthaxia mashuna
m. Type , Det. Dr. Obenberger [p+h]”.
Anthaxia chalcogenioides
.

Syntypes (
2 males
,
1 female
, MRAC ): “Musée du Congo , Welgelegen,
Jan. 1912
[p] // Holotypus [red, p] //
Anthaxia pilifrons Kerr.
[h] //
Anthaxia chalcogenioides
Type Burg. [h] // R. DÉT. A 57 [p]” (male); “Musée du Congo , Katanga: Lubombo,
xii. 1928
, Ch . Seydel, c. 1951 [p+h] // Paratype [red, p] // Lubombo, Décbre 1929 , Ch . Seydel [p] // C. 1951 [h] ” (female); “Musée du Congo , Katanga: Lubombo,
xii. 1929
, Ch . Seydel [p+h] // Paratype [red, p]” (male).
Anthaxia morula
. Holotype by monotypy (female, LCDF ,
Fig. 12
): “Kvg [h] //
morula Théry
[h],
TYPE
[p, red]”.

Having studied and compared all type specimens mentioned above and extensive material of
A . mashuna
(see
Bílý & Sakalian, 2014
) I failed to find any substantial differences and I propose that
A . morula
Théry, 1947
to be conspecific with
A . mashuna
Obenberger, 1931
and a junior synonym. I have failed to solve the abbreviation “Kvg” on the locality label but in the description (
Théry 1947
) the type locality is more precisely given as “Cubango, Dr. Monard, une seule exemplaire”.

Again, I treated
A. morula
erroneously in the subgenus
Cratomerus
(
Bílý, 1997
, 1999 ) based on the illustration in the description (see Fig. 33 in
Théry 1947
). Without any doubt it belongs to the subgenus
Haplanthaxia Reitter, 1911 (
Bílý & Sakalian, 2014
)
.

Distribution. Democratic Republic of the Congo , Kenya , Malawi , Mozambique , Tanzania , Zambia , Zimbabwe .
Bellamy ( 2008 )
recorded this species also from Botswana , however, without any citation.
